com.twistral.toriamath.utils

Class TMath

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.twistral.toriamath.utils.TMath

  • public final class TMath
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that has a lot of utility functions.
    Few methods in this class were written by Tommy Ettinger.
    Few methods in this class were taken from Apache Commons Math, most of these methods were changed in many ways to fit telek-math.
    To see every method that wasn't written by me, see the sections below in this class that were seperated by big multiline comments.

      • mapRange

        public static double mapRange(double oldRangeLeft,
                              double oldRangeRight,
                              double newRangeLeft,
                              double newRangeRight,
                              double oldValue)
        Takes oldValue from the range [oldA, oldB] and returns what it would represent if it was in range [newA, newB]
        Parameters:
        oldRangeLeft - start value of old interval (left value)
        oldRangeRight - end value of old interval (right value)
        newRangeLeft - start value of new interval (left value)
        newRangeRight - end value of new interval (right value)
        oldValue - any value from the old interval aka [oldRangeLeft, oldRangeRight]
        Returns:
        The new value of oldX in the new interval aka [newRangeLeft, newRangeRight]

      • mapRange

        public static double mapRange(TRange oldRange,
                              TRange newRange,
                              double oldValue)
        See Also:
        mapRange(double, double, double, double, double)

      • mapRange

        public static double mapRange(double oldValue)
        Takes oldValue from [-1,1] and returns what it would be in [0,1]
        Parameters:
        oldValue - any value from [-1,1] interval
        Returns:
        the value of oldX in [0,1] interval

      • asinFloat

        public static float asinFloat(float a)
        This method was written by Tommy Ettinger.
        Parameters:
        a - any float
        Returns:
        arcsin(a), it is faster than Math.asin(a) but not as accurate

      • acosFloat

        public static float acosFloat(float a)
        This method was written by Tommy Ettinger.
        Parameters:
        a - any float
        Returns:
        arccos(a), it is faster than Math.acos(a) but not as accurate

      • probit

        public static double probit(double d)
        This uses an algorithm by Peter John Acklam, as implemented by Sherali Karimov. Original source. Information on the algorithm. Wikipedia's page on the probit function may help, but is more likely to just be confusing.
        Parameters:
        d - should be between 0 and 1, exclusive, but other values are tolerated
        Returns:
        a normal-distributed double centered on 0.0; all results will be between -38.5 and 38.5, both inclusive
